descbody.para: All painting operations must be carried out in a location designed for these operations (e.g. booths).
The spraying booths must comply with the standards currently in force (air speed at 0.40m/s or above, no measurement below 0.30m/s).
Periodic maintenance and checking of these facilities ensures their safety and quality.

noteR.para: Always wear protective gear (gloves, goggles and breathing masks).

descbody.para: When drying with an infrared device, it is important to respect:

ul.li: the distance, time and temperature specified on the product technical sheet. Use a distance thermometer part number: 77 11 237 210.
the user and safety advice given by the manufacturer of the infrared device.

descbody.para: In the same way as for paintwork, the safety equipment (masks, filter cartridges, gloves, safety goggles, overalls, etc.) for this equipment can be acquired from your local IXELL supplier.

ul.li: if (T) is lower than or equal to 60°C, the vehicle is permitted to pass through the booth,
if (T) is above 60°C, the traction battery must be removed before it enters the booth,
if the traction battery core reaches 60°C, the traction battery will be damaged,
the maximum time the traction battery can be exposed to 60°C is 35min.
if (T) is lower or equal to 65°C: the CNG vehicle is permitted without emptying the fuel tank,
if (T) is between 65°C and 80°C the vehicle is permitted in the booth only if the fuel tank is emptied,
if (T) is greater than 80°C the CNG vehicle is not permitted in the booth unless the tank has been emptied and removed.
When a vehicle enters a spray booth, remove the tank as a precaution or carry out flaring and degassing with a flare, then make it inert with a nitrogen flush.

If equipment (infrared lamp, etc.) needs to be used for drying mastic, primer or paint, near to the LPG tank, such as during a retouching procedure, it is essential to carry out flaring and degassing of the LPG tank and then to make it inert with a nitrogen flush.

noteR.para: If working at under 50°C, it will be possible to leave the tank in place, on condition that it is filled to less than 70% of its capacity.

ul.li: When the vehicle comes with original high durability varnish, it is strongly recommended that IXELL IXALIS type anti-scratch varnish is used during the repair.
Using this type of varnish guarantees the original function of the high durability varnish.

descbody.para: Each time a panel is stripped in the workshop when drilling, degrease and wipe the area and then use a fine paintbrush to apply the following:

ul.li: Paint in the vehicle body colour
When painting a component which has been hit by gravel, it is advisable to add a flexible additive to the bi-component primer and to the varnish or topcoat.

If the vehicle has tri-coat paintwork or tinted clearcoat, a "tri-coat supplement" labour time must be assigned once in addition to the paintwork preparation fixed price and the two-coat paintwork labour time assigned for the operation on the affected component.
